chunks.original_text: 幽静深岩图宴坐，息无来往气坚凝。 却粒着其能， 生成火，返本气澄清。 九候浴时开地户，月中取火日求冰，五内换重新。 解曰：七转之后，形神俱妙，内府皆为仙器。 日中游行，身体通明，色如红玉，飞举腾空，纵横任意。 大抵须要内外和顺，使之日月光华。 会于心肾水火，阴阳交通，神气和会。 深入岩谷之中宴坐千百日。 闭鼻息，以绝呼吸之气，冲和凝定。 然后内实，不食尘世之物，以证逍遥之道也。 至于却粒，不食真奇功、奇道也。 闭息千日，神火内发，荡洗谷气，更无食念。 返本还元，抱一守静。 故曰：还返气澄清，凡遇神火五脏发热，则逢三九之日，入于水中，澄其真丹，光明如火轮之状，从地户出。 故曰：开地户月者，阴之象也。 神火至阳之物也，户者阴之窍，通阳光从地户阴穴而出。 故曰：月中取火也。 日者阳物也，舌者阳之窍，通流神水，从舌窍阳穴而出。 故曰：日求冰也。 五转换骨，六转换肉，七转换五脏，五内者五岳也。 故曰：五内换重新也。 口诀: 丹成至七转，当离尘世，入深山之中，或岩谷间宴坐、闭息精神，口鼻绝往来之息。 使真阴真阳交于腹，夺天地造化之功，归于四体。 千日之后，五脏换尽，胎气变为仙府。 但觉顶门窍开，出黑赤之气。 乃是胎气发散，千日数足，顶门窍合。 乃是胎气出尽，七转功满也。 自此之后，五脏结实，不纳烟火。 若有时五脏丹火发，则入水中闭定鼻息，使丹珠神火从地户而出。 浮于水面，如牛弄黄，直候舌下神水如泉，则丹火息吸其丹珠，复入地户。 直至八转地带成就，无火毒则不复浴也。 第八转 八转还元地带垂，周行胎息养婴儿。 有时火发烧丹窟。 深入寒泉弄赤龟。 解曰：婴儿在母腹中，胞胎里定气，不能出之象，神水至清之入，而无所损。 若婴儿脐中有脐带，衔在口中，呼吸之气往来不绝。 此乃自然胎息。 故无损也。 丹成八转之后，换于脐中生一，脐带亦如婴儿之状，还其本始之道，故曰还元地带垂也。 婴儿得脐带行胎息之气，故无所损，真人得地带行周天之气，故能长生也，赤龟丹珠也。 八转之后，内炼真火，使无热毒之患，凡遇火发，即口衔地带闭息，九日至第九日，真水自丹田如涌泉泛涨，直至重楼十二环，丹珠在其神水之中，如龟之戏水。 自此之后，真火无毒，更无丹热之患。 故曰有时火发烧丹窟，深入寒泉弄赤龟。 望江南 内外变，八转始还元。 地带长垂主坎户，周行胎息贯天门。 太始道方存， 纯一体，赤黑气常喷，丹火发时烧内景。 冷泉涌处浴猴孙，神水赤龟吞。 解曰：丹至八转，外之形体，内之五脏，尽底换变。 复生地带，如小儿之状，故曰返本还元也。 地带者脐下之带也。 生于脐中，属北方坎卦，故曰：坎户天门，华池之窍地、带贯于口中。 行周天之息，以调火候，故曰：周天息也。 太始之道，生天地之始，丹成八转，如天地造化之初也。 内丹纯阳也。 无一点阴气，故曰纯一体也。 黑赤者神火之气也。 丹成八转，自心而来，常从鼻中出入。 常见黑赤二气，故曰：气常喷也。 丹火之患，运神水以制之，更无丹火之候。 盖丹者心珠，心家猴孙也。 赤龟火神也，丹浮于水之中，如龟吞水取其状也。 口诀:

Secluded in the depths of silent cliffs, one sits in meditation,
breath still, with no coming or going—qi solidifies and congeals.
Rejecting grains reveals its power,
for fire is born of life,
and returning to the root, qi becomes limpid and clear.

When bathing during the ninefold cycles, the Earth-gate opens;
from the moon one gathers fire, from the sun seeks ice—
the five viscera are renewed anew.

*Explanation:*
After the seven revolutions, form and spirit both attain subtlety,
and the inner organs all become vessels of immortality.
Roaming at midday, the body becomes luminous,
its hue like red jade,
soaring and ascending through space, moving freely at will.
In general, one must ensure inner and outer harmony,
so that the radiance of sun and moon
converges in the heart and kidneys, water and fire,
with yin and yang in communion, spirit and qi in harmony.
Deep within mountain valleys, one sits in meditation for hundreds or thousands of days,
closing the nostrils to sever the breath,
so that the harmonious qi congeals and settles.
Then the inner self is replete,
no longer consuming the dust of the world,
thereby realizing the Dao of carefree wandering.

As for rejecting grains, not eating is a marvelous achievement and wondrous path.
After a thousand days of breath-holding,
the spirit-fire blazes within,
scouring away the qi of grains,
eradicating all thoughts of food.
Returning to the root and reverting to the origin,
embracing the One and guarding stillness—
thus it is said: *Returning, qi becomes limpid and clear.*
Whenever the spirit-fire causes the five viscera to grow hot,
on the third nine-day period,
enter the water,
clarify the true elixir,
which shines like a wheel of fire,
emerging from the Earth-gate—
thus it is said: *Opening the Earth-gate.*
The moon is a symbol of yin;
spirit-fire is a thing of utmost yang.
The gate is a yin aperture,
through which yang light emerges from the yin cavity of the Earth-gate—
thus it is said: *From the moon one gathers fire.*
The sun is a yang thing;
the tongue is a yang aperture,
through which spirit-water flows,
emerging from the yang cavity of the tongue—
thus it is said: *From the sun seeks ice.*
The fifth revolution changes the bones,
the sixth revolution changes the flesh,
the seventh revolution changes the five viscera—
the five viscera are the five sacred peaks,
thus it is said: *The five viscera are renewed anew.*

*Oral Instructions:*
When the elixir reaches the seventh revolution,
one should leave the mundane world,
enter deep mountains or secluded valleys to sit in meditation,
seal the breath and spirit,
cutting off the coming and going of breath through mouth and nose.
Let true yin and true yang merge within the abdomen,
seizing the creative power of heaven and earth,
returning it to the four limbs.
After a thousand days,
the five viscera are entirely transformed,
and the fetal qi becomes a celestial palace.
One may feel the aperture at the crown open,
releasing black and red qi—
this is the dispersal of fetal qi.
When the thousand-day count is complete,
the crown aperture closes—
this signifies the fetal qi has fully emerged,
and the seventh revolution is perfected.
From this point onward,
the five viscera are solid and replete,
no longer consuming smoke and fire.
If at times the elixir-fire of the viscera blazes,
enter the water, seal the nostrils,
and let the elixir-pearl and spirit-fire emerge from the Earth-gate,
floating on the water’s surface like a cow playing in yellow mud.
Wait until the spirit-water beneath the tongue flows like a spring,
then absorb the elixir-pearl and spirit-fire,
returning them to the Earth-gate.
This continues until the eighth revolution’s *Earth-sash* is accomplished,
and with no fire-toxins remaining, one no longer needs to bathe.

*Eighth Revolution*
At the eighth revolution, the *Earth-sash* hangs, returning to the origin,
circulating fetal breath to nurture the infant.
When fire blazes, scorching the elixir-cave,
plunge deep into icy springs to play with the red turtle.

*Explanation:*
The infant in the mother’s womb,
within the fetal sac, stabilizes its qi,
unable to expel it—
this is the image of spirit-water in its utmost clarity,
entering without loss.
If the infant’s umbilical cord
is held in its mouth,
the breath comes and goes without cease—
this is natural fetal breathing,
thus it suffers no harm.
After the elixir reaches the eighth revolution,
an umbilical cord-like *Earth-sash* grows from the navel,
resembling the infant’s form,
returning to the original Dao of inception—
thus it is said: *The Earth-sash hangs, returning to the origin.*
The infant obtains the umbilical cord to circulate fetal breath,
thus suffering no harm;
the perfected one obtains the *Earth-sash* to circulate the qi of the celestial cycle,
thus attaining longevity.
The red turtle is the elixir-pearl.
After the eighth revolution,
one refines the true fire within,
eliminating the affliction of heat-toxins.
Whenever fire blazes,
clasp the *Earth-sash* in the mouth and hold the breath.
From the ninth to the ninth day,
true water surges from the elixir field like a gushing spring,
rising to the twelve-storied tower of the *Double Pass*,
with the elixir-pearl within the spirit-water,
like a turtle playing in the water.
From this point onward,
the true fire is free of toxins,
and the affliction of elixir-heat no longer arises—
thus it is said: *When fire blazes, scorching the elixir-cave, plunge deep into icy springs to play with the red turtle.*

*Gazing at the River South*
Inner and outer transform,
the eighth revolution begins the return to the origin.
The *Earth-sash* hangs long, mastering the *Kan-gate*,
circulating fetal breath to pierce the *Heavenly Gate*.
The Dao of the Great Beginning now abides.
A pure, unified body,
black and red qi ever-spouting—
when elixir-fire blazes, scorching the inner landscape,
at the surging of icy springs, bathe the monkey-grandson,
spirit-water and red turtle swallow.

*Explanation:*
When the elixir reaches the eighth revolution,
the outer form and inner five viscera
are entirely transformed.
The *Earth-sash* regenerates,
resembling that of an infant—
thus it is said: *Returning to the origin.*
The *Earth-sash* is the cord below the navel,
born from the navel,
belonging to the northern *Kan* trigram—
thus it is said: *The Kan-gate and Heavenly Gate.*
The aperture of the *Flowery Pond* and the *Earth-sash* enter the mouth,
circulating the breath of the celestial cycle
to regulate the fire-times—
thus it is said: *Circulating celestial breath.*
The Dao of the Great Beginning
is the origin of heaven and earth;
when the elixir reaches the eighth revolution,
it is like the inception of heaven and earth’s creation.
The inner elixir is pure yang,
without a trace of yin qi—
thus it is said: *A pure, unified body.*
Black and red are the qi of spirit-fire.
When the elixir reaches the eighth revolution,
it arises from the heart,
constantly entering and exiting through the nose,
ever manifesting as black and red qi—
thus it is said: *Qi ever-spouting.*
The affliction of elixir-fire
is tempered by circulating spirit-water,
leaving no sign of elixir-heat.
The elixir is the heart-pearl,
the monkey-grandson of the heart;
the red turtle is the fire-spirit.
The elixir floats within the water,
like a turtle swallowing water—
this describes its form.

chunks.original_text: 丹成八转，地带生于脐中，若遇丹火犹发热。 五脏热燥，即闭目宴坐。 以地带接于华池之下，使息气内通流行，周遍运用之道。 自闭息之后，丹田真水日日渐长，至第九日，神水直至重楼十二环，丹珠隐于神水之中，出去火毒。 自此之后更无发燥之患。 至第九夜子时，闭息吸神水从泥丸宫过夹脊复丹田以毕其功也。 第九转　功行毕 九转逍遥道果全，三千功行作神仙。 金书玉简宣皇诏，足蹑祥云谒九天。 解曰：丹成九转，造化成就，道果圆成，更积外行三千，外果圆满，方可飞升。 故许旌阳，丹成之后，除蛟龙之害，然后上升。 孙思邈丹成之后，救万民之疾，然后上升，皆须立功成名方得上升也。 上升之日，天乐来迎，箫韶合奏，以过天关，随功行分职，列为仙班，与天地相为长久也。 内丹诀陈朴冲用撰九转金丹秘诀泥丸先生陈朴传 一转歌、第一转舌下四窍，两窍通心两窍通液。 一转之功似宝珠，山河宇宙透灵躯。 红莲叶下藏丹穴，赤水流通九候珠。 一转之功似宝珠 天一真水，藏之于胆，阴阳和合，降而为丹，状如露珠一颗。 内丹之功，起于一而成于九。 一者，万物之所生也。 天一生水，地二生火，天三生木，地四生金，天五生土。 五行之序起于一，故内丹之功亦起于一。 转而成于九者，九为阳数之极，数至于九，则道果成矣。 似宝珠者，言天一真水藏于胆，阴阳和合，降而成丹。 初降之状如露一颗明珠。 珠者、珍敬其丹也。 山河宇宙透灵躯 人因父精母血交媾而生身，形交也。 丹因心火肾水交媾而丹降，气交也。 丹降之时，神游方外、阴阳太和、至忘其形，天地山河、六合万物、在我身之内、我身在天地之外。 只觉此中，一点光明如日，乃丹降也。 人之有身，父精母血交媾而成，此形交也。 丹之所降，心火肾水交媾而成，此气交也。 故曰：形交则生人，气交则成丹。 言其丹降之后，神游方外，阴阳太和； 坐忘其形，天地山河； 六合万物，皆在我身之内。 我身在天地万物之外，只觉心中一点光明。 乃是丹降也。 故曰：山河宇宙透灵躯，躯者、身也。 山河包藏我身之内也。 红莲叶下藏丹穴 舌下两窍，左通心，右通胆。 真气流注以通神明。 故人身不安，则舌下液干，以其真气耗也。 一转之首，以舌闭其两窍，使真气不泄于外，以通其神水也。 所谓红莲者，舌是也。 自两窍通心，两窍通液。 人有病者，则舌下津液干而其真气耗。 一转之首以舌闭其两窍，使真气不泄于外，以通其神水也。 赤水流通九候殊 赤水液也，九转之首。 每遇九日，细息九次。 每次入口九口，自然津液通流，自舌而生，以灌下藏，乃九候也。 所谓赤水者，心之液是也。 九转之首，每遇九日纳息九次。 每一次纳息九口。 自然津液通流自舌下，而生以灌五脏，故曰九候珠也。 望江南闭舌下窍，通胆气。 黄中宝，须向胆中求。 春风令人生万物，乾坤膝下与吾俦，百脉自通流。 施造化，左右火双抽。 浩浩腾腾光宇宙，苦烟烟上霭环楼，夫妇渐相谋。 中黄宝须向胆中求 天一生气，名曰中黄。 其气藏于胆，以为性命之根元。 其味苦，至如无知花木根蒂之味亦苦，乃知万物非生气不能生也。 内丹之药先闭舌下两窍，内通胆中生气，至喉舌之间，有微微苦味，是生气通流。

When the elixir completes its eighth revolution, the earth-belt arises within the navel, and if elixir-fire still causes heat, with the five viscera parched and dry, close the eyes and sit in repose. Connect the earth-belt beneath the Flowery Pond, allowing the breath to circulate internally, flowing and pervading through the revolving Dao. After closing the breath, the true water of the elixir field gradually increases day by day. By the ninth day, the spirit-water ascends to the Twelve-Storied Tower, and the elixir-pearl conceals itself within the spirit-water, expelling the fire-toxin. Thereafter, no further affliction of dryness arises. At midnight on the ninth night, close the breath and draw the spirit-water from the Mud-Pill Palace, passing through the Spine-Strap back to the elixir field to complete the work.

**Ninth Revolution:**
When the work of nine revolutions is done,
the Dao-fruit of carefree wandering is complete.
With three thousand merits of conduct,
one becomes an immortal.
Golden writ and jade tablets proclaim the imperial decree,
feet treading auspicious clouds to pay homage in the Nine Heavens.

**Explanation:**
When the elixir completes its ninth revolution, the transformation is perfected, and the Dao-fruit is fully realized. Only after accumulating three thousand merits of external conduct and fulfilling the external fruit can one ascend. Thus, after refining his elixir, Master Xu of Jingyang eradicated the harm of flood dragons before ascending. After refining his elixir, Sun Simiao healed the ailments of ten thousand people before ascending. All must establish merit and achieve renown before ascending. On the day of ascension, celestial music arrives in welcome, with flutes and zithers harmonizing to pass through the Heavenly Gate. According to one’s merits and conduct, one is ranked among the immortals, joining the celestial ranks to endure as long as heaven and earth.

**Internal Elixir Secrets: Nine Revolutions of the Golden Elixir**
*Composed by Chen Puchong of the Mud-Pill Tradition*

**First Revolution Song:**
Beneath the tongue lie four apertures,
two linking to the heart, two to the fluids.
The work of the first revolution resembles a precious pearl,
permeating mountains, rivers, and the cosmos with a numinous body.
Beneath the red lotus leaves lies the elixir-cavern,
crimson water flowing through the nine-marked pearl.

The work of the first revolution resembles a precious pearl.
The true water of Heavenly One is stored in the gallbladder,
where yin and yang harmonize and descend as the elixir,
appearing like a single dewdrop.
The work of the inner elixir begins with one and is completed in nine.
One is the origin of all things.
Heavenly One generates water, earthly two generates fire,
heavenly three generates wood, earthly four generates metal,
heavenly five generates earth.
The sequence of the five phases begins with one,
thus the work of the inner elixir also begins with one.
It is completed in nine revolutions, for nine is the utmost of yang numbers.
When the number reaches nine, the Dao-fruit is achieved.
The "precious pearl" refers to the true water of Heavenly One stored in the gallbladder,
where yin and yang harmonize and descend as the elixir.
Its initial descent resembles a single luminous dewdrop.
The pearl is cherished as the elixir.

**Permeating mountains, rivers, and the cosmos with a numinous body:**
The human body arises from the union of father’s essence and mother’s blood—this is the union of forms.
The elixir descends from the union of heart-fire and kidney-water—this is the union of qi.
When the elixir descends, the spirit roams beyond the mundane,
yin and yang achieve great harmony,
and one forgets the body entirely.
Heaven and earth, mountains and rivers,
the six directions and the myriad things
all reside within this body,
while this body exists beyond heaven and earth.
One only perceives within a single point of radiance like the sun—
this is the descent of the elixir.
The human body arises from the union of father’s essence and mother’s blood—this is the union of forms.
The descent of the elixir arises from the union of heart-fire and kidney-water—this is the union of qi.

while the union of qi forms the elixir.
After the elixir descends, the spirit roams beyond the mundane,
yin and yang achieve great harmony,
and one sits in forgetfulness of the body.
Heaven and earth, mountains and rivers,
the six directions and the myriad things
all reside within this body,
while this body exists beyond heaven and earth.
One only perceives a single point of radiance within the heart—
this is the descent of the elixir.
Thus it is said: *permeating mountains, rivers, and the cosmos with a numinous body.*
The body encompasses mountains and rivers within itself.

**Beneath the red lotus leaves lies the elixir-cavern:**
Beneath the tongue lie two apertures,
the left connecting to the heart, the right to the gallbladder.
True qi flows to communicate with the spirit.
Thus, when the human body is unwell, the fluids beneath the tongue dry up,
for the true qi is depleted.
At the outset of the first revolution,
the tongue seals these two apertures,
preventing the true qi from leaking outward
and enabling the spirit-water to flow.

When one is ill, the fluids beneath the tongue dry up, and the true qi is depleted.
At the outset of the first revolution, the tongue seals these two apertures,

**Crimson water flowing through the nine-marked pearl:**
The crimson water is the fluid.
At the beginning of the nine revolutions,
every nine days, perform nine subtle breaths.
With each breath, take nine sips,
naturally allowing the fluids to flow,
arising from the tongue to irrigate the five viscera—
these are the nine marks.
The "crimson water" is the fluid of the heart.
At the beginning of the nine revolutions,
every nine days, take nine breaths,
with each breath taking nine sips.
Naturally, the fluids flow from beneath the tongue
to irrigate the five viscera—
thus it is called the nine-marked pearl.

**Song of Gazing at the River South:**
Seal the apertures beneath the tongue to connect with the gallbladder’s qi.
The treasure of the Yellow Center must be sought within the gallbladder.
The spring wind brings forth the myriad things,
while beneath heaven and earth, it is my companion.
The hundred meridians flow naturally.
It enacts transformation,
drawing the paired fires from left and right.
Vast and billowing, it illuminates the cosmos,
ascending in wispy smoke to encircle the tower,
as the couple gradually conspire.

**The treasure of the Yellow Center must be sought within the gallbladder:**
The qi of Heavenly One is called the Yellow Center.
This qi is stored in the gallbladder,
serving as the root of life and destiny.
Its flavor is bitter,
just as the roots and stems of plants and trees are also bitter—
thus it is known that nothing can grow without the generative qi.
For the medicine of the inner elixir,
first seal the two apertures beneath the tongue,
internally connecting to the generative qi of the gallbladder.
When a faint bitterness arises between the throat and tongue,
the generative qi is flowing.

leaving no sign of elixir-heat.
The elixir is the heart-pearl,
the monkey-grandson of the heart;
the red turtle is the fire-spirit.
The elixir floats within the water,
like a turtle swallowing water—
this describes its form.

Then seek the spirit to become the elixir.
The qi of Heavenly One is called the Yellow Center.
This qi is stored in the gallbladder,
serving as the root of life and destiny.
Its flavor is bitter—
thus the qi and flavor of the human gallbladder are also bitter.
Just as the roots and blossoms of plants and trees are bitter,
it is known that nothing can grow without the generative qi.

For the medicine of the inner elixir,
first seal the two apertures beneath the tongue,
internally connecting to the generative qi of the gallbladder.
When a faint bitterness arises between the throat and tongue,
the elixir qi is flowing.
Then the mercury-water congeals to form the elixir.

The decree of the Spring Lord brings forth the myriad things—
all things receive the spring qi before they can grow.
When one connects to the qi of the gallbladder,
the inner elixir is accomplished.
The generative qi of Heaven and Earth sprouts in spring;
all things receive this generative qi before they can grow.
Humans, too, receive this generative qi,
storing it in the gallbladder.
When one connects to the qi of the gallbladder,
the inner elixir achieves the first turning of its work,
like the spring of the four seasons.

Heaven and Earth lie beneath my knees,
as the hundred vessels flow freely.
The generative qi ascends,
and bitterness is sensed in the mouth.
Yin and Yang achieve great harmony,
and the spirit dwells beyond the heavens—
then the four seas and all under heaven lie beneath my knees.
The vast qi fills Heaven and Earth,
the hundred vessels flow freely,
and the myriad apertures open wide,
as the inner elixir descends.
The generative qi ascends within,
and bitterness is sensed—
Yin and Yang achieve great harmony,
and the spirit dwells beyond the heavens—
then the four seas and all under heaven lie beneath my knees.
The vast qi fills Heaven and Earth,
the hundred vessels flow freely,
and the myriad apertures open wide,
as the inner elixir descends.

At the outset of practice,
first seal the two apertures beneath the tongue,
preventing the qi from leaking outward.
The qi of the left and right apertures rises from within:
the left passes through the left Greater Yang to enter the brain,
while the right, together with the left, traverses the brain to reach the crown.
In the Mud Pill Palace, they merge as one,
then descend the Twelve-Storied Tower,
entering the Heart Channel and passing into the gallbladder,
where they surge open the gallbladder’s aperture,
causing the generative qi within to ascend.
Following the vessels of the heart and gallbladder,
it pierces the tongue’s aperture,
and the tongue senses a bitter flavor—
this is the generative qi flowing,
about to descend the elixir.

When the tongue senses a bitter flavor,
this is the generative qi flowing,
about to descend the elixir.

Vast and billowing, it fills the cosmos;
wispy smoke ascends to encircle the tower.
Once the gallbladder’s aperture opens,
the generative qi rises in wisps,
ascending the Twelve-Storied Tower
to enter the aperture beneath the tongue.
The mouth senses bitterness—
this is the sign of the generative qi flowing.
Then, sealing the tongue’s apertures,
the qi on left and right ascends,
creating a billowing effect.
Once the gallbladder’s aperture closes,
the generative qi rises in wisps,
ascending the Twelve-Storied Tower
through the aperture beneath the tongue.
The mouth senses bitterness—
this is the generative qi flowing.

The couple gradually conspire.
When the generative qi flows freely,
Yin and Yang achieve great harmony,
and the heart and kidneys unite in congress—
thus it is said they gradually conspire.
The couple represents Yin and Yang:
the husband is Yang, the wife is Yin.
When the generative qi flows freely,
Yin and Yang achieve great harmony,
and the heart and kidneys unite in congress—
thus it is said they gradually conspire.

At the outset of practice,
first regulate diet to harmonize the five viscera,
avoiding hunger or overfullness.
The field of the heart must be tranquil,
free from worry or distraction—
only then can one enter the Dao.

first regulate diet to harmonize the five viscera,
neither hungry nor overfull.
The field of the heart must be tranquil,
free from worry or distraction—
only then can one enter the Dao.

When the second watch ends and the third begins,
first wash and rinse,
then enter a quiet chamber to burn incense.
Sit cross-legged, close the eyes, and concentrate the spirit.
When the breath is even,
curl the tongue back to seal the two apertures at its root,
gradually holding the breath.
Sense the two channels of qi in the Greater Yang meridians,
rising from the roots of the molars
to pierce the Greater Yang and enter the crown,
reaching the Mud Pill Palace—
this counts as one cycle.

Sense the two channels of qi in the Greater Yang meridians,
rising from the roots of the molars
to surge upward, piercing the two Greater Yangs,
then entering the crown.
When the two qi merge,

Then open the eyes for a while,
close them again to concentrate the spirit,
and curl the tongue as before,
waiting for the qi to reach the Mud Pill Palace before stopping.
Do this three times each night.
Then close the eyes for a while,
again curling the tongue as before,
waiting for the qi to reach the Mud Pill Palace before stopping.
Do this three times each night.

After several nights, or ten days, or half a month,
gradually sense the qi reaching the Mud Pill Palace,
then flowing into the brain,
descending the Twelve-Storied Tower,
passing through the spine to thread the tailbone and rise upward.
The true qi enters the heart and pierces the gallbladder,
warming the stomach with a gentle heat,
bringing a subtle sense of harmony and ease—
this is the true qi descending.

After several nights or days,
gradually sense the qi reaching the Mud Pill Palace,
then flowing into the brain,
descending the Twelve-Storied Tower,
piercing the spine to thread the tailbone and rise forward.
It enters the heart and pierces the gallbladder,
warming the navel and stomach with a gentle heat,
bringing a subtle sense of harmony and ease—
this is the true descent.

After several more nights of practice,
gradually sense the qi reaching the heart,
then a gentle warmth,
or a faint stirring of qi at the heart’s center.
A warm qi then rises behind the heart,
passing the Twelve-Storied Tower
to enter beneath the tongue.
